text: We are planning to create a branch for 0.7 soon and increment master to 0.8 prior to some upcoming architectural changes

<@U1A7EF0S0> added a Jira ticket to look into speeding up the test suite. Looking for volunteers to analyze the tests and look for unnecessary redundancy.
<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/STL-13>
A helpful place to start would be to ‘profile’ the tests being executed from bin/run_tests to see where the majority of the time is going

I pull the current master, and in the "master" branch,  ran ./bin/run_tests,  and found only tests of test_config.py passed, all of others failed. Is there anything we need to do more to run ./bin/run_tests?

attachments.fallback: [November 18th, 2016 5:48 AM] mitchell: Based on a recent PR, developers will need to do `python setup.py clean —all; python setup.py build` in sawtooth-core/validator and a `python setup.py build` in sawtooth-core/signing
attachments.text: Based on a recent PR, developers will need to do `python setup.py clean —all; python setup.py build` in sawtooth-core/validator and a `python setup.py build` in sawtooth-core/signing
